## useFrameworkSettings() function

Return a \[value, setter\] tuple for a resource's settings, just like the normal recoil useRecoilState. The variant here is that this allows you to target a specific resource's settings, and the setter also optionally accepts a key to target a specific value instead of the entire block. Note that setting the entire block does a merge over the previous, not a complete overwrite.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function useFrameworkSettings(resource?: string): [any, (value: any, key?: string) => void];
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  resource | string | <i>(Optional)</i> |

<b>Returns:</b>

\[any, (value: any, key?: string) =&gt; void\]
